Generation V.Black: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.
Generation V.White: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
Generation V.Black 2: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
Generation V.White 2: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.

Generation VI.X: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
Generation VI.Y: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.

Generation VII.Sun: Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
Generation VII.Moon: It explores caves in search of underground water. It's not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The energy overflowing from its body has turned into orange crystals that are hard enough to smash diamonds.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They're valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.

Generation VIII.Sword: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It's about to fire off bursts of energy.
Generation VIII.Shield: It relies on sound in order to monitor what's in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it's facing.

Generation V.Black: Chargestone Cave , Mistralton Cave , Twist Mountain , Challenger's Cave , Victory Road , Giant Chasm
Generation V.White: Chargestone Cave , Mistralton Cave , Twist Mountain , Challenger's Cave , Victory Road , Giant Chasm
Generation V.Black 2: Relic Passage , Wellspring Cave , Chargestone Cave , Mistralton Cave , Clay Tunnel , Twist Mountain , Reversal Mountain , Seaside Cave , Victory Road , Underground Ruins Chargestone Cave ( N's Pokémon )
Generation V.White 2: Relic Passage , Wellspring Cave , Chargestone Cave , Mistralton Cave , Clay Tunnel , Twist Mountain , Reversal Mountain , Seaside Cave , Victory Road , Underground Ruins Chargestone Cave ( N's Pokémon )

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Mirage Caves (west of Route 115 , north of Fortree City , north of Route 124 , southeast of Route 129 ; all by Rock Smash )
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Mirage Caves (west of Route 115 , north of Fortree City , north of Route 124 , southeast of Route 129 ; all by Rock Smash )

Generation VIII.Sword: Route 8 , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror , Giant's Cap , Lake of Outrage Rolling Fields , Giant's Seat , Stony Wilderness , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Route 8 , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror , Giant's Cap , Lake of Outrage Rolling Fields , Giant's Seat , Stony Wilderness , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Fields of Honor ( Max Raid Battle ) Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )
